medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute diffuse abdominal pain radiating to the back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient awoke with acute diffuse abdominal pain that radiated to the back. She experienced associated nausea but no vomiting. The pain was not related to food and the patient could not recall any antecedent fatty meal. Pain was severe initially, but she was pain-free after receiving morphine prior to transfer.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on Coumadin, diabetes mellitus, heart failure with preserved ejection fraction, gastroesophageal reflux disease, hyperlipidemia, history of coronary artery disease, previous coronary artery bypass grafting, and chronic kidney disease.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of gastrointestinal malignancy or myocardial infarction.
medical_history.social_history: Denies significant alcohol history. No prior abdominal surgeries or history of cholelithiasis.
